what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal tilt.eu.taxonomy assess whether product SME eligible EU taxonomy regulation.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version tilt.eu.taxonomy GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("2DegreesInvesting/tilt.eu.taxonomy") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("2DegreesInvesting/tilt.eu.taxonomy")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: products Europages company matched Ecoinvent activities. test whether Europages products EU Taxonomy eligible, match Ecoinvent activities products EU Taxonomy activities. matching process determines whether product taxonomy-eligible . Ecoinvent activity matches taxonomy activity, classified eligible. product match taxonomy activity, classified eligible.

what: ChatGPT match validation between Ecoinvent activities and EU Taxonomy activities’ description
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: EU taxonomy provides description column taxonomy activity contains information . Hence, propose use additional information validate whether ecoinvent activities covered taxonomy activity description . ChatGPT used validate using Yes (covered well) (covered well) matched ecoinvent_activity_name tax_activity_description. used OpenAI’s gpt-4-turbo model validation following prompt:
code: "We have a dataframe with columns 'ecoinvent_activity_name' and 'taxonomy_activity_description'. Check row wise whether the ecoinvent activity (column 'ecoinvent_activity_name') covered by the EU Taxonomy activity description (column 'taxonomy_activity_description').
